title: Weird noise
body: Hey.. Whenever I'm playing League my computer makes a weird sound and it just stops working, it won't answer anything, I can only turn it off.. I just got the computer, I don't know what's happening.. Also, I can play 3v3 just fine on twisted treeline but whenever its 5v5 either Summoner's Rift or Howling Abyss it makes that sound! And I don't have skype on or anything, and I tried lowering the graphics.. Does this happen to anyone else?! Is it normal?! How can I fix it?! ... Please help :(

replies.body: I dont really know what that means? Sorry im noob with this tech stuff

Good news: i dont know, really.
Bad news: if you dont know what "OS" means, you computer is probably fucked with viruses beyond the point of salvation.

**Specs: **"specifications" - the hardware, parts and versions for your computer, which you should know by heart of you play games. Most of them can be found under "system information" on windows.
**OS: **Operating System, like windows 7, windows 10, Ubuntu, OS X Yosemite, ect.
**Drivers:** Software that runs important hardware in the computer, in this case the graphics processor (GPU). Outdated or incorrect driver versions cause all sorts of issues.


A computer crashing when it is trying to load a program suggests one of a few things: corrupt or damaged hard drive areas, a virus that is interfering in come way, or corrupt/modified graphics drivers, although i have never heard of bad drivers causing a full system freeze.
My bet is on hard drive problems, especially if the computer is more then 5 years old.

**Here is what you should do:**
Get the free version of malwarebytes antimalware. It is possibly the best free virus-removal program. Install it, run a full scan of your computer. It cant hurt, and it may help. Do it every few months.
https://www.malwarebytes.com/

If you are on **windows**, run CHKDSK "Check Disk", this is a windows tool that checks your hard drive for damage or errors.
Guide to running CHKDSK on any recent windows version. 
http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/windows-vista/guide-to-using-check-disk-in-windows-vista/
Choose the disk to check ( C disk, if you have more than one), if it cannot check while the computer is running, schedule the check and restart the computer.
If it finds any issues, it will prompt repairs.
If you are on **mac OSX,** use this to check for disk problems http://www.howtogeek.com/236978/how-to-repair-disk-and-file-system-problems-on-your-mac/


If on **windows**, type "windows update" into start menu search and check for updates, this should include graphics drivers and security updates.
On **mac**, updates are usually handled automatically.

There's nothing wrong with the computer(came with windows 7) , I just got it, I have McAfee, I've ran it a few times to check if there is any viruses, but there is not.. All I use my computer for is netflix, league and skype. I'm extra careful so my mom won't use any movie sites besides netflix so she doesn't even use the computer cause she knows i dont want viruses. I have my firewall activated at all times, I only turn it off to play league and I turn it on right after I stop playing. So I doubt it's the computer. At least it can't be about virus. Maybe my computer is too weak to support 5v5? But I play 3v3 with high quality and everything and it wont even lag, but when its 5v5 I put everything on low and it just bugs. Nothing will work..

Why would you turn off the firewall to play league? If that is required for it to run properly, something is definitely wrong. It definitely gives no performance improvement, the time it takes the firewall to process packets would be measured in nanoseconds.

Does it only happen on summoner's rift, or does it also happen on crystal scar or howling abyss? 
Have you tried running CHKDSK? It really sounds like some of the data for SR is in a corrupt or damaged hard drive sector, nothing else should cause a full system crash under such specific conditions.

Also, Mcafee kind of sucks <_<

I got my system info so you can see if it's something with the computer..
Edition: Windows 10 Home
Version: 1607
OS Build: 14393.222
Product ID: 00325-80517-07988-AAOEM
Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-5005U CPU @ 2.00GHz 2.00 GHz
Installed RAM: 4.00 GB
System Type: 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor 

What else should I know? I don't understand any of this :/ I should learn more about technology && If I don't have my firewall off, league does not work. A lot of my friends have to turn theirs off aswel so I thought that was normal! Also, I downloaded the malwarebytes, as you recommended, and ran it, ran the threat scan and apparently there is nothing threatful!

Not at all normal. i suggest you look up information on how to make a firewall rule to allow LoL to work, and turn the firewall back on.

It would help to know what your GPU is, if you have one. I am a bit perplexed by that CPU, it is very new, very expensive, and very, very bad. It looks like an entry-level laptop cpu, but ones a third of the price from the same generation are several times faster.  (it is a bit weaker than my 5-year-old my i3-2100, and that can barely run graphics for a browser by itself).

Check if you have a dedicated graphics card, it should be under system information > hardware > display, or something similar, it would be a NVIDIA or AMD processor. If you do, it could be malfunctioning or accidentally turned off (windows 10 laptops love doing this for some reason).

If so, follow these instructions to turn it on for LoL http://www.pcadvisor.co.uk/how-to/pc-components/how-set-default-graphics-card-3612668/
it's now working perfectly! Thank you for the help!
